results.title: Hattie
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Suzanne Barker, Dept of Social Security and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Security”.
Hattie is seventy-six and completely alone, she has lost contact with a of her old friends and interests and feels that her life is now totally empty. Although she has always been happy and active, Hattie says she doesn’t care if she dies tomorrow, and that there are a lot of people like her, discarded because they are old. One of a series of films created originally for day- time television panel discussions to introduce to the public the range of social services available from Government and other agencies.

results.title: The Happy toilers
results.creator_credit: Keith David Smith and Children's Library and Craft Movement
results.brief_description: An amateur record of the efforts by children attending a crafts centre in a migrant hostel to build their own swimming pool. Made at Bradfield Park Housing Settlement and the Lane Cove National Park.

results.title: Half of mankind
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, United Nations and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: This film deals with community development in Asia. The village is the unit of organization on which Asia rests, and it is the basis of community development. Three examples are shown: simple self-help in Cambodia; villages cooperating with the World Health Organization to run a health clinic in Afghanistan; interdependence of the agricultural and industrial communities in India, with cash crops providing capital for agricultural development and mechanized expansion of village crafts with the aid of electricity.

results.title: A Half million teenagers
results.brief_description: Studies the physiology aspects of venereal disease. Uses animation to show how the organisms of gonorrhea and syphilis enter and affect the body and how the diseases may be recognised. Stresses the need for treatment, pointing out that there is a cure for both diseases.

results.title: The Great War
results.creator_credit: Alan Anderson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War Experience”.
Uses contemporary film records of the Australian forces in the 1914-18 War to illustrate the conditions in which they served and the effects on survivors.

results.title: Golf in Australia
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Illustrates the wide popularity of golf in Australia, showing the variety of courses and outlining training schemes and other aspects of the sport. Concludes with scenes from professional tournaments.

results.title: Goldtown
results.creator_credit: R. Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of Australia’s fabulous town with the “golden mile” - Kalgoorlie in Western Australia, a goldmining town in the midst of a forbidding desert where the water supply is piped hundreds of miles overland.

results.title: Going Our Way
results.creator_credit: Chris Gallagher, Victorian Railways and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the many employment opportunities in the Victorian Railways. A young boy playing with his toys, including a train, dreams of his future. He becomes a station assistant. Shows how he learns his job and benefits from the V.R.I. library and sporting clubs. Includes executive officers who started at the bottom and worked their way to the top.

results.title: Gift of life
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of the collections of blood from donors and its use in hospitals. Stresses the need for blood for transfusions every hour as part of medical service today; the procedure of voluntary donation, facilities provided and the careful labelling, testing and typing carried out by the Red Cross staff; the method of refrigerated storage and transport; use of separated components; an operation in process with the assistance of blood transfusions.

results.title: Ghan to Alice
results.creator_credit: Curtis Levy, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Follows two rodeo riders travelling from Moree to the Alice Springs Rodeo on the Ghan train. Includes shots of the country through which the Ghan passes and briefly looks at towns along the route. Commentary by Bill Willougby.
